page.title: 14Employment_Morcombelake area
page.content: The indigenous families are in the main connected with the farms or with occupations depending upon farming. In recent years purely farmworkers have reduced drastically in number with the introduction of modern farming techniques and machines, but being of a resourceful and practical nature people have been able to adapt to these new activities. Many of the younger generation have set up small buisnesses connected with land use or general building activities.. The nearby small town of Bridport offers work in the old established netting and rope industry and in holiday catering and services generally. The well known Moores Biscuit factory employs a small number of workers.
